org.apache.drill.exec.store.easy.text.reader

Class CompliantTextBatchReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.drill.exec.store.easy.text.reader.CompliantTextBatchReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ManagedReader<ColumnsSchemaNegotiator>

    public class CompliantTextBatchReader
extends Object
implements ManagedReader<ColumnsSchemaNegotiator>
    New text reader, complies with the RFC 4180 standard for text/csv files

    • Constructor Detail

      • CompliantTextBatchReader

        public CompliantTextBatchReader(TextParsingSettings settings)

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public boolean open(ColumnsSchemaNegotiator schemaNegotiator)
        Performs the initial setup required for the record reader. Initializes the input stream, handling of the output record batch and the actual reader to be used.
        Specified by:
        open in interface ManagedReader<ColumnsSchemaNegotiator>
        Parameters:
        errorContext - operator context from which buffer's will be allocated and managed
        outputMutator - Used to create the schema in the output record batch
        Returns:
        true if the reader is open and ready to read (possibly no) rows. false for a "soft" failure in which no schema or data is available, but the scanner should not fail, it should move onto another reader

      • next

        public boolean next()
        Generates the next record batch
        Specified by:
        next in interface ManagedReader<ColumnsSchemaNegotiator>
        Returns:
        number of records in the batch

      • close

        public void close()
        Cleanup state once we are finished processing all the records. This would internally close the input stream we are reading from.
        Specified by:
        close in interface ManagedReader<ColumnsSchemaNegotiator>
